sourceComments:
[I] am surprised too / even [I] am surprised.

datte: also, as well; even
"datte" has different meanings and I found it often hard to understand. The occurrence in this sentence is explained in more detail by maggie sensei (case 4/5 - emphasize what comes before). Note that this is different from "mo", it rather carries the meaning of "even" as pointed out on Japanese stackexchange.

Don't worry about the difference, I found it helpful to either translate it to "too" or "even".
reading: おれ だって びっくり だ
